name: Onestop Medical Clinic - Covid Vaccination Venue
info:
• Onestop Medical, a Primary Care Clinic is serving the community by administering COVID-19 vaccines as a giving back in the current difficult situation since January 2021. Please DO NOT disrespect our hardworking staff and volunteers. No profanity please.
	
	• We are administering Pfizer COVID-19 vaccines to the patients age 12 years and above.
	
	• Due to the social distancing limitations and limited parking, please plan to arrive NO earlier than 5 Minutes. Please DO NOT park in front of our neighbor’s building; 1316 Central Ave S. The extra public parking is available next door at the Kent Municipal Court (1220 Central Ave S, Kent, WA 98032).
	
	• We ask that for everyone’s safety, please DO NOT visit this vaccination drive without an appointment. Please DO NOT email or call us to inquire, schedule, reschedule, cancel your appointment about COVID-19 Vaccine as we are experiencing extremely high email and call volumes. Please DO NOT book an appointment from the Zocodoc or Onestop Medical's website for COVID-19 Immunization.
	
	• Please schedule your Dose 2 through Prepmod.doh.wa.gov between 21 to 42 (at least 17 days considering grace period) days apart. Please DO NOT laminate the vaccine card. 
 
	• Please remember that you will need to bring your photo ID/Passport, medical insurance card (if insured). If you're receiving your 2nd vaccination, you will be required to bring your vaccination card too.

	• We DO NOT accept any form of payment, donation for COVID-19 vaccine from any patient. Please DO NOT make any payment to the Onestop Medical. If you receive a bill for your COVID vaccine, please contact your insurance company First.
	If you DO NOT have an insurance, no worries and you will still receive your vaccine.
	If you have Insurance a small Admin Fee will be charged to the insurance. The patient DOES NOT PAY for any vaccine related services out-of-pocket  The Admin Fee will be used to help cover a portion of the cost to maintain the staff, PPEs and all medical need.
	
	https://www.doh.wa.gov/Emergencies/COVID19/VaccineInformation/VaccineCost#heading67668
special: If you are signing up for a second dose, you must get the same vaccine brand as your first dose.

name: Consistent Care Services- COVID Vaccine Site
vaccines: Janssen COVID-19 Vaccine, Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine
info:
***This is a clinic for 1st or 2nd doses of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine for anyone 12 years or older OR the single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine for anyone 18 years or older. *** All patients 12-17 years old are only eligible for the Pfizer vaccine. (If 12-17 years old must be with a parent or guardian or have parental/guardian consent) Vaccinations at this mobile clinic are by appointment only. This clinic is at the Hillyard Library located at 4005 N. Cook St., Spokane WA 99207. Enter the building at the time of your appointment. 

***Residents of ANY state are now eligible for the vaccine, but you still must have photo ID***

*VERY IMPORTANT*
***Please complete all the insurance/Medicare/Medicaid information when registering online for your appointment to avoid filling it out at the clinic***
special: If you are signing up for a second dose, you must get the same vaccine brand as your first dose.

name: Yakima Community Vaccine Center
info: ***PFIZER VACCINATIONS*** !!!!VACUNAS DE PFIZER!!! Enter fairgrounds through Gate 15 off of Pacific Avenue. Be prepared to show confirmation of your appointment or you may experience a slightly longer wait. Masks are required. Please wear clothing which allows access to your shoulder. Vaccinations at this site are reserved for people who live and/or work in Washington State. All Minors age 17 and Under must go to the Walk-in Tent located by the Admin Building. Ingresar por la puerta 15 en la avenida Pacífico. Se requieren máscaras. Por favor, use ropa que permita acceso a su brazo. Las vacunas en este sitio están reservadas para las personas que viven o trabajan en el estado de Washington. Todos los menores de 17 años o menos deben ir a la carpa sin cita ubicada junto al edificio administrativo.*** PFIZER VACCINATIONS*** !!!!VACUNAS DE PFIZER!!!
special: If you are signing up for a second dose, you must get the same vaccine brand as your first dose.

name: Lewis County Mall
vaccines: Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine, Janssen COVID-19 Vaccine, Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine
info:
****This is a MODERNA and PFIZER 2ND dose AND Johnson & Johnson vaccine clinic.**** and is by appointment or walk in. Please note: Moderna and J&J vaccine can only be administered to individuals 18 years of age or older according CDC requirements. PFIZER 2nd dose appointments shall be granted priority and will be administered to minors and adults from age 12 and up.

This clinic is located at the west end of the Lewis County Mall in the former Sears location. Please park in front or to the west end of the building. This is a walk in location. Please let us know if you or someone you are with needs assistance of any kind.  **You should also plan your visit around waiting for 15 minutes in the observation area so we can monitor for any unlikely adverse reactions to the vaccine.** Certain people with pre-identified conditions or past anaphylaxis events may be asked to wait for 30 minutes of observation.

Free language translation services are provided. Video ASL translation is also provided.

Please bring your vaccination card from your 1st Moderna/Pfizer dose and your  appointment confirmation. Please do not come if you are feeling ill. Please arrive as close as possible to your scheduled time to prevent crowding that will impede appropriate social distancing. - It is best to wear clothes that will allow for access to your upper arm, just below the shoulder.   **Masks are still required at all vaccination sites. If you do not have a mask, one will be provided.
special: If you are signing up for a second dose, you must get the same vaccine brand as your first dose.
